intro: Canarium acutifolium var. celebicum, commonly known as the Celebes candlenut, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and fragrant, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, hard-shelled fruits that contain a dark, oily seed used in traditional medicine and as a source of oil. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts.
